html: Assyria’s “fall”—like the fall of all entities comprising Greater Babylon—concludes Jehovah’s Day of Judgment on a wicked world. Besides being “fought in mortal combat” (Isaiah 30:32), Assyria perishes by a heavenlysword —Jehovah’s secret weapon (Isaiah 49:2). Unlike physical human weapons, this manifestation of Jehovah’s power is divine. As the king of Assyria/Babylon personifies Jehovah’ssword ,ensign , andfire to destroy the wicked, so Jehovah’s servant, his divinely appointed opponent, personifies Jehovah’ssword ,ensign , andfire to deliver Jehovah’s elect and to destroy Assyria.
